cards.title: Intro
cards.body: A quick reference cheatsheet for Kotlin that includes usage, examples, and more.

cards.title: main()
main()
cards.body: The main() function is the starting point of every Kotlin program and must be included in the code before execution

cards.title: Print statement
cards.code:
println("Greetings, earthling!")
print("Take me to ")
print("your leader.")

/*
Print:
Greetings, earthling!
Take me to your leader.
*/

cards.title: Notes
cards.code:
// this is a single line comment

/*
this
note
for
many
*/

cards.title: Execution order
Type inference
String concatenation
cards.code:
var streetAddress = "123 Main St."
var cityState = "Brooklyn, NY"

println(streetAddress + " " + cityState)
// Print: 123 Main St. Brooklyn, NY

cards.title: String Templates
Built-in Properties and Functions
Character escape
cards.body:
```kotlin {.wrap}
print("\"Excellent!\" I cried. \"Elementary,\" said he.")

cards.title: Character escape
cards.body: // Print: "Excellent!" I cried. "Elementary," said he.

cards.title: Character escape
cards.code:
- `\n` insert new line
- `\t` inserts a tab
- `\r` inserts carriage return
- `\'` inserts a single quote
- `\"` inserts a double quote
- `\\` inserts a backslash
- `\$` inserts a dollar sign

### Arithmetic Operators

cards.title: Character escape
cards.code:
`+` addition, `-` subtraction, `*` multiplication, `/` division, and `%` modulus

### Order of operations

cards.title: Character escape
cards.body: var batteryPercentage = 80

cards.title: Character escape
cards.body:
// long syntax
batteryPercentage = batteryPercentage + 10

cards.title: Character escape
cards.body:
// short syntax with augmented assignment operator
batteryPercentage += 10

cards.title: Character escape
cards.body:
var year = 2019
year++   // 2020
year--   // 2019

cards.body: var morning = true

cards.body: var rained = false

cards.body: // print: you are considered senior

cards.title: Character escape
cards.body:
var myAge = 19
var sisterAge = 11
var cousinAge = 11

cards.title: Character escape
cards.body:
myAge > sisterAge  // true
myAge < cousinAge  // false
myAge >= cousinAge // true
myAge <= sisterAge // false

cards.body:

var raining = true
var jacket = false

cards.title: Character escape
Character escape
cards.body:
var hungry = true
var full = false

cards.title: Character escape
cards.body:
println(!hungry) // false
println(!full)   // true

cards.title: Character escape
cards.body:
!true && (false || true) // false
/*
(false || true) is evaluated first to return true.
Then, evaluate !true && true and return the final result false
*/

cards.title: Character escape
cards.body:
!false && true || false // true
/*
!false is evaluated first to return true.
Then true && true is evaluated, returning true.
then, true || evaluates to false and eventually returns true
*/

cards.title: Character escape
cards.body:
var a: String = "Kotlin" // a can never be null
a = null // compilation error
var b: String? = "Kotlin" // b can be null
b = null // ok

cards.title: Character escape
cards.body:
val a = "Kotlin"
val b: String? = null
println(a.length) // can be called safely, because a is never null
println(b?.length) // b?.length returns the length of b, or null if b is null
println(a?.length) // Unnecessary safe call

cards.title: Character escape
cards.body: bob?.department?.head?.name // chain returns null if any property is null

Character escape
cards.body: val l = b!!.length // throws a NullPointerException, if b is null
